channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023070803
item.description:
Report X-2023070803

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: driver placed a code 10 on this package and brought it back to the station. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023070690
item.description:
Report X-2023070690

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070690 SequenceEvent: Package was placed on the back of the trailer with nothing securing it and with the loose cap it tipped over and contents leaked out DescribePack: one of the caps was not secured so when package tipped contents leaked out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was turned upright and placed into a salvage drum. 2. X-2023070691 SequenceEvent: package was loaded on the end of the trailer with nothing to secure it and with the loose cap some of the contents leaked out DescribePack: 1 of the jugs had a loose cap which leaked out some contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023070891
item.description:
Report X-2023070891

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: OSSEO
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package sent on sorter from unload box was wet when it got to the door on load side and was leaking. Pulled from conveyor and called out to QA. DescribePack: can clips on lid were popped off due to lake of inner packaging and proper shipping procedures. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA used absorb pads to soak up spill .Maint .scraped off conveyor and equipment

item.title: Report E-2023070602
item.description:
Report E-2023070602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver was attempting to off-load a roll-off box in the lot when liquid started to spill out of the top of the roll-off under the cover. He stopped immediately once he noticed the spill and put down containment booms and adsorbent. The spill was contained on a paved parking lot and did not reach any waterways. The cleanup was done using the appropriate PPE and was put into the appropriate containers for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070443
item.description:
Report E-2023070443

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 5 gallon pail of paint (un1263) releasing 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
